pull.title: ci: Print inner env, Make ccache config more flexible
pull.body:
The outer env is printed when the `/tmp/env-$USER-$CONTAINER_NAME` is created. There is also a separate env printed when building the container image (usually with default values).

To confirm that the inner container env is correctly derived from the outer env, and not from the default build env, print it a third time.

rename.to: ci: Print inner env, Make ccache config more flexible

verification.payload:
tree ffaba31bab17798fad910a0ed36b68a7ad07744d
parent fa7dac315318617acc31dd60942f7c85a8cbf642
author MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1726057055 +0200
committer MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1726121319 +0200

ci: Bump default CCACHE_MAXSIZE to 500M

This also allows to drop individually hardcoded values, which are
impossible to overwrite and hard to maintain.

events.message:
ci: Bump default CCACHE_MAXSIZE to 500M

This also allows to drop individually hardcoded values, which are
impossible to overwrite and hard to maintain.

verification.payload:
tree 5bada1ef1ece6439604e7c937b082976bac8c11f
parent fad32a5c76315bc8ba4908bba8c1049c101f99c5
author MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1726057629 +0200
committer MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1726121327 +0200

ci: Remove hardcoded CCACHE_DIR in cirrus

This makes it easier to overwrite the value.

Also, drop the dot in the CCACHE_DIR fallback value.

events.message:
ci: Remove hardcoded CCACHE_DIR in cirrus

This makes it easier to overwrite the value.

Also, drop the dot in the CCACHE_DIR fallback value.

verification.payload:
tree 9364ede78f04e6cafdc4fb6f3376d0fc059291ca
parent fa58bb74bb126e91572585e8477962931f1383ed
author MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1726060171 +0200
committer MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1726121439 +0200

ci: Allow CCACHE_DIR bind mount

This may be useful. For example, to store the directory in a specific
place, instead of having to use a volume.

Possibly, but not limited to sharing a cache:
https://ccache.dev/manual/4.10.1.html#_sharing_a_local_cache

events.message:
ci: Allow CCACHE_DIR bind mount

This may be useful. For example, to store the directory in a specific
place, instead of having to use a volume.

Possibly, but not limited to sharing a cache:
https://ccache.dev/manual/4.10.1.html#_sharing_a_local_cache

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -48,6 +48,12 @@ if [ -z "$DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST" ]; then
     CI_PREVIOUS_RELEASES_MOUNT="type=bind,src=${PREVIOUS_RELEASES_DIR},dst=$PREVIOUS_RELEASES_DIR"
   fi
 
+  if [ "$DANGER_CI_ON_HOST_CCACHE_FOLDER" ]; then
+    # Same as above, but only for ccache
+    mkdir -p "${CCACHE_DIR}"
+    CI_CCACHE_MOUNT="type=bind,src=${CCACHE_DIR},dst=$CCACHE_DIR"
comments.body:
nit: are you using the two separate variable reference styles because the second one doesn't have any characters after it? To be fair, the first also ends with a `,` so I think we can simplify this:
```suggestion
    CI_CCACHE_MOUNT="type=bind,src=$CCACHE_DIR,dst=$CCACHE_DIR"
```

This is sourced usually through `test_run_all.sh`, right?
What was the reason for such low values before?
the dot is dropped since it's not a [home dir](https://ccache.dev/manual/latest.html#config_cache_dir), right?

nit: commit message has subject-verb agreement problem
> the build path**s** are constant
